page.title: 02THE VILLAGE OF ABERDYFI
page.content: Aberdyfi is a comparatively modern village.A report dated 1569 states that there were only 2 or 3 houses in the area.Fishing was the main occupation with herring, salmon and mackerel in plentiful supply. During the 18th and 19th centuries the village grew rapidly as a port. Shipping and shipbuilding became a major industry.Between 1840 and 1880 forty five ships were built in the shipbuilding yards at Penhelig. The coming of the railway in 1867 began the slow decline of Aberdyfi as a port. The last boats to sail to and from Aberdyfi were the s.s.Dora and the s.s.Telephone. Today the former port area has been redeveloped and the economy of the village is completely dependent on the tourist industry.
